description:
A game of Merchants and Builders in Old Pisa
In Pisa during the fourteenth century gold rules over all. The great families of the city are the route to success, wealth, and power. Merchant houses compete to make deals with the great families and earn the greatest profits. Meanwhile, master builders erect splendid palaces, marvelous tower houses, beautiful plazas, and fabulous shops, hoping to impress the great families and earn prestige. The center of this quest for wealth and prestige is the Lungarno district, along the banks of the River Arno. Can you overcome your rivals to dominate the Lungarno and become the richest merchant in Pisa?

Overview:
Using tiles, you will build the various districts of Lungarno, sending your merchants to trade with the four great families (represented by shields of different colors). When a district is complete, you will earn profits for your merchants, based on the prestige of the families in that district.
At the end of the game, the player with the most gold is the winner!

Components:

     13 Special board pieces
     65 Building tiles
     55 Florin coins (20 yellow - worth 5 and 35 Grey)
     25 Merchants (5 of each color)
     12 Privilege tokens
     Rulebook


Expanded by:


     Lungarno: Luminara

A variation of the Monopoly-style investment game. The goal: to become the wealthiest player by purchasing investments and collecting investment returns from other players.

Game equipment includes a game board, dice, six playing pieces, play money, "ownership markers", "investment broker" charts, and economy / world affair cards.

Players roll two dice to move around the board. Actions are dependent on where the player lands and can include buying or selling different types of investments, doubling your investment, trading in your automobile, drawing a card and following the instructions, or following other instructions on the board.

If a player runs out of funds and is unable to meet the obligations of any creditor, they have gone "belly up." The last player left is the winner.

This is a Flemish version of the Monopoly Game.  The game was published bij deSka from Brussels.  Gameplay is the same as the original Monopoly.

Places on the board:
Go: Start
Free Parking: Vrij Parkeren
Gaol: Gevangenis
Go To Gaol: Naar De Gevangenis
Income Tax: Inkomsten Belasting
Luxury Tax: Extra Belasting
Chance: Kans
Community Chest: Algemeen Fonds
Indigo: Leuven, Dieststraat / Mechelen, Bruul
Gray: Leuven, Bondgenotenlaan / Turnhout, Gasthuisstraat / Turnhout, Leopoldstraat
Purple: Aalst, Lange Zoutstraat / Brugge, Vlamingenstraat / Knokke, Kustlaan
Orange: Brugge, Steenstraat / Oostende, Kapellestraat / Kortrijk, Rijselstraat
Red: Tienen, Leuvensestraat / Gent, Kortrijksestraat / Hasselt, Grote Markt
Yellow: Antwerpen, Groenplaats / Brussel, Lakenstraat / Gent, Veldstraat
Green: Antwerpen, Huidevettersstraat / Gent, Vlaanderenstraat, Hasselt, Demersstraat
Blue: Antwerpen Meir, Brussel Nieuwstraat
Railway Stations (Stations): Noordstation, Centraal Station, Buurtspoorwegen, Zuidstation
Utilities: Electriciteitscentraal, Waterdienst

Thrilling adventure among the planets. An educational game designed to provide hours of thrilling entertainment for young astronauts while they become acquainted with this new and exciting race through space.

From the rules:
"Loaded down with jewels and other precious stones that sparkle and twinkle, the Vikings have just got back from their latest foray. Under a cheering hubbub they unpack the treasure booty and start distributing it. Vikings, keep cool! Don't reach out for your divvy too quickly. Perhaps if you wait, the more precious pieces will arrive on a later ship!?

Aim of the game is to be the player with the most jewels at the end of the game. The players collect equipment cards and as soon as a Viking ship returns from a foray to the village the treasure load is distributed. Whoever has the most suitable equipment cards, and can bid correctly, will win all the jewels from ship's treasure. But watch out, don't display too many cards or be too greedy!"

The aim of the game is to collect the most fish.

You have to try to gather kitten gangs! Whoever manages to gather either three identical cats or any three cats on the same colored background, receives a fish as a reward.

Uncover any card and place it in front of you. One by one all players uncover a card to try to collect a kitten gang of three identical cats or any three cats on the same colored background.

-There can never be more than three cards in front of you. When it's your turn and you already have three cards, you have to return one of them face up to the center of the table and only then can you uncover a new card.

-Instead of uncovering a hidden card you can also take a card from the ones face-up in the center, except for the one you just placed there.

Napoleonic miniature wargaming at 1:50 scale with 15mm miniatures. The smallest command element is a Division, miniatures are organized into Regiments. The rules include orders of battle for the 1809 Austrian campaign.

"Being in the Main a Rules System for Miniature Colonial Naval Wargames, ca. 1860-1914 A.D."

Miniature wargame rules for coastal and riverine warfare for the colonial period. Intended to be used with The Sword and the Flame rules but can be played as a "stand alone".

Miniature wargaming rules for American Civil War at 1:20 scale. Based on the General de Brigade system.

Includes two scenarios:


     Antietam: Opening Attack (1862)
     Fredericksburg: Marye's Heights (1862)

This is a hunting game that consists of driving out to the hunting lodge, spending 5 days (laps around the lodge area) hunting, then driving back home.  Aside from rolling dice to determine how far to move the game is played primarily with a big composite spinner, which determines the outcome of things like shooting game, luck at the horse track, and playing poker.  Everyone starts with $300 and 5 credentials.  Driving is mostly uneventful except for small financial transactions.  Luck "in the field" is determined by flipping over situation cards when you land on situation space.  Some cards have animals you can try to shoot at, others have bad luck type situations you need to over come by moving or playing a credential card.  Each time a player circumnavigates the lodge (spends one day hunting) they receive a credential and have an opportunity to answer a hunting or safety related question for a cash bonus.

Content: board, 4 x 4 pawns in 4 colors

Bugs surround sheltering the buds which start to bloom. Which bugs are the busiest?

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bayreuth, in Germany.

15 great games chosen because they are easy to learn, reward multiple playings & appeal to a wide variety of players.... plus, the kids at El Carmelo Elementary liked 'em. :-)

Hoppers / Mini-Hoppers (Halma on a 10x10 and 4x4 board, respectively)
The Game of Y
The Royal Game of Ur
Surround (a Go variant)
Corsaro
Solitaire
Pentominoes
Morris (Nine Men's & Three Men's)
Scatter (Conspirateurs)
Tigers & Goats (Bagh Chal)
Roundabouts (Surakarta)
Fanorona
China Moon
Checkers (Everyday, Giveaway & Super King)
Push Penny Bounce

The object of the game is to obtain the most treasures. Treasures are awarded by completing tasks. Each turn the player turns over the hour glass, then turns over the first treasure card. Depending on the card, various tasks must be performed before the time runs out; pantomiming animals, matching cards, grabbing for specific animals...

If the players wish to push their luck, they can turn over yet another treasure card and attempt to complete another task. If, however, time runs out, the players lose all of the accumulated treasure cards. They can stop after completing a card and retain the current round of treasures they've collected.

If you love puzzles and games you will love From The Gecko™.

From The Gecko™ is a unique speed math game that focuses the player on understanding numbers and making quick decisions. 
Fun for kids of all ages, even grown-ups! Kids will have a blast while learning and laughing. Will you be the first to build your gecko? Great for all ages.

For 2 to 6 players. 
Made in the USA.

Parents and teachers created our products to be effective learning tools, which entertain and educate. The "Fun with™" series of products are designed to stimulate the language and learning skills in young children by introducing two languages seamlessly.

Fun with Numbers™ will help a child learn to count from 1-20 in two languages. The product teaches sequencing and associates a corresponding object with that number. Learning sequencing is an important factor in pre-reading skills.

English - Spanish - Box set includes: DVD, workbook and game cards.

Ages 4 and up 
2 to 4 players.

Bible Picture Lotto

This is a vintage (1950s era?) religion game.

"Learn Bible stories while you play"

Ages 5 - 10

"Beautiful full-color picture cards with over forty illustrations"

"Six Bible stories"

Includes 6 large picture boards and 36 small picture cards. The boards represent Bible characters like Daniel, Moses, Joseph, etc.

The cards feature objects from the Biblical character's life (Daniel/Lion, etc.) and players match the cards to the correct Bible story.

Warner Press No. T3841

Wooden dowels of the same thickness are placed within a wooden ring and then twisted so they balance on the table. Players roll a colored die which determines which dowel they must remove from the ring (colors are green, orange, and blue). Each dowel is worth 1 point. The player with the most points when the structure collapses (when the ring hits the table) is the winner.

Each player takes on the management of an independent kingdom that has its capital on one of the four continents surrounding the Middle Sea. Using military power, economic might and religious influence players vie to increase the size of their kingdoms. Players must also guard against unrest, which could cause rebellion or even civil war to break out. With several paths to victory, players may choose peaceful economic expansion, military invasion, religious unrest or a combination of all three to defeat their rivals.

The requires one piecepack, a box of kitchen matches or small wooden/plastic rods to represent goods, roads and ports and about fifty pennies (or tokens) to represent gold.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

During his turn a player rolls the single die (d6, distr.: 1/2/2/3/3/4) and moves his car. He must surmount some difficulties named action spaces. 
The first player who finishes his 4th round wins the Piston Cup.

The game illustrations are taken from the Disney/Pixar movie "Cars".

From the website:

Coalescence is an abstract strategy game in which two to five players manipulate the movements of colossal crystalline nuggets of star-stuff in a spiral galaxy, attempting to create the largest stellar systems and capture them with their immense star-scoops! Can you choose between setting up a sweet chunk of fusion for yourself now, or grabbing a promising patch of space for yourself that might be worth a bundle later?

Each Coalescence set is lovingly handcrafted in Austin, TX. Contains 22" cloth board and 60 acrylic crystal nuggets, and 12 hand-painted wooden capture rings.

CANCELLED GAME

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Call of Duty Real-Time Card Game will not enter production.  This entry currently serves as a placeholder for the announced item and will likely later be removed.

    


A real-time battle based card game where players deploy 3 soldiers to the battlefield from their squad deck. Action cards activate these soldiers, as they battle it out in real-time. Soldiers fire, move, dive for cover, and attack the enemy, with the first player to a  certain number of frags declared the winner. Decks from different countries can be combined to create new strategies.

Two players set up on a 5x5 grid and attempt to win through either earning a preset number of points won by kills or achieve some other mission based objective such as capture the flag. The different "game modes" are quite similar to what one would find in the video game upon which it is based.

The game plays in real time so players are forced to find a balance between speed and strategy. Each player has a deck from which they draw cards one at a time and play them as fast as they can (or discard them if they cannot be played). Certain cards trigger a pause in the action at which time all effects (except movement which is handled as it comes up) are resolved.

Each of the 8 different, but non-collectible, squad decks come with:

    60-card deck
    8 Soldier cards
    2 Mission cards
    Double-sided game map
    Rules sheet

Object of the game is to make high score by building a series of sentences with different word requirements. Cards are separated by various parts of speech (color coded. Each player gets a card rack and stores their cards like you would place your scrabble tiles. Instead of making words with letters you make sentences with words. 
The game is separated into 6 rounds/ There is different requirements for each round using verbs, nouns, adverbs, conjunction, interjection, adjective etc...
The winner is the player that earned the most points at the end of the sixth round.

Each player represents a nation of Europe seeking wealth from a newly discovered island during the age of colonial expansion: England, Pirate Confederation, Spain or France. After forming the isle, players move colonist crews (coins) across the isle on foot, or around the coast by sea in a ship (pawn). Crews exploring new land on foot claim new property for their port (null tile), may establish a mine (die), and fight enemy colonists. After a mine is established, crews may mine the site and transport silver (tokens) to their colony or their ship. The ship may transport silver and/or crews around the coast of the isle and to Europe (off board).

Silver Isle is played with a Piecepack set and the rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Matches is an easy game that will exercise your memory and deduction, as well as press your luck. It is enjoyable for children and adults, and also plays well with mixed groups of both.

Rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Cranium bills itself as the "whole-brain" game.  It borrows from a range of party and parlour games, including charades, Pictionary, trivia, and the like.

Cranium Édition Québécoise is packed with quintessentially Québécoise content (written in French).  Do you think you can hum "When you're in love?" Or, carve a poutine?

Four Shinto priests have traveled from their various prefectures in pilgrimage to the top of Mount Fuji. You must find pathways for them to move up and down the mountain until they can all achieve the summit. Often, this will require you to guide them into positions from which they can assist each other.

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

The big one is coming! Don't wall in the Pacific Ocean.

Players place coins to establish cities and roll dice to determine when quakes will happen. Tiles will shift and cities will be destroyed. If your cities are closer to the Ocean at game end you'll have the most valuable property and win the game.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

From the rules:
"In a playful way, the players together broaden their vocabulary, practice the structure of syllables and the rhythm of words.
...
Whoever is imaginative and eloquent in describing the motifs on the picture cards, will be the first to collect four different postcards.
...
Lets start with the zippy tour straight across Europe! The children travel by train, car, plane or boat and try to visit, as quickly as possible, four of five European capitals in order to collect postcards. It is however not so easy to move on as it doesn’t depend just on throwing the dice. Only the one who carefully looks at the pictures and proves to have enough imagination in describing them, will reach their aim."

The game is set during World War Two, where you are a German tank commander who has to get his battle-worn tank safely back to friendly faces. The only way back is through a small village, but this contains elements of enemy infantry.

It is a card driven game, and there are two types of card. Terrain cards, which is the pack you are trying to go through as quickly as possible, where the last card is always the Bridge card. There are also Event cards which mainly contain enemy soldiers. Each card has an activation number, the activation level is decided by shuffling activation cards into the Terrain deck. So the further into the village you go the more likely you are to meet enemy opposition.

You give orders to your crew, spending order points. Example: prepare main tank gun, load main tank gun, move turret, observe etc. Your tank creates noise which attracts enemy soldiers and the terrain you move over may also have a bearing on this as well.

Combat is a series of dice rolls, not everyone's favourite part of the game but most wargamers will be okay with this. Also included are the use of Schürzen (side skirts), Zimmerit paste, PIAT attacks, a Sherman, and tank traps.

We've all been victims at one time or another of those brazen goblins who scurry around the nursery when no one is looking to hide the toys. Now players can get everything back!

In Verfühlt nochmal!, when everyone joins hands and calls out "Fiddle Faddle!", the hunt is on for the missing items in the magic pouches. If a player feels for a toys and takes the wrong one, then they are out for the rest of the round. Players with sensitive fingertips can recover the correct lost toys.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the Roman Republic! The aim of the game is to win political control of the Republic. The two areas of play are the Provinces in the electoral circuit and the Offices. Players will place influence tokens in the Provinces in the hope of winning provincial elections which provide influence. Magistrates and Governors also provide influence, and can be used to take special actions which will help players defeat their rivals. The game ends once all 24 Provinces have been decided, in which case the player with the most influence from both the Provinces and the Offices wins.

Equipment Needed:
a) 1 standard piecepack;
b) about $2 in change to represent gold (ideal breakdown would be 50 x 1c, 10 x 5c, 10 x 10c;
c) cubes in 4 different colors to use as influence markers (20 per player);
d) a printout of the Table of Offices from the rules

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

The Seven Years War & The War of Austrian Succession  is an area movement game of these two conflicts.

The game system uses the simple RISK method of combat:  highest roll with a twist, cards are not areas conquered but are events that can give the player an advantage or create a disadvantage for an opponent.  Cards offer extra troops, use of neutrals, generals, force an opponent out of the conflict, ect.

Number of players can run from 2 to 7 allowing for much diplomacy between players.

Game is available through Calumet Armchair Wargamers at RB1863@Yahoo.com

Educational game for teaching elementary math. A player starts by taking a face up card or one from the deck. The player then checks his hand for any matching pairs to form a complete and correct simple arithmetic equation. These pairs are placed face up on the table, and the player then discards one card. The game continues until one player rids his hand of all pairs.

The cards in this game show situations from the daily life of young kids. Each card has a short, positive message. With the 42 cards, 8 different games can be played.
By playing these games, the children will learn to treat each other (and themselves) with respect.

Get in the ring and win!
Ultra Fight is fast 2 player game.
Players take on a role of one of 23 fighters cards of different martial arts (tae-kwon-do, judo, kung-fu, boxing, karate, sumo...). Players try to choose smart between 8 action cards and win by knock-out or submission or there will be "judges" decision-on points. This is first game designed and illustrated by Sven Nemet.
There are also two scoring boards and 6 cards that gives you plus points.

Octacompass is a two-player strategy game that uses an eight-sided die to determine which direction your pieces can move.  The die is labeled with the 8 directions of the compass which determines the direction your piece can move.  You can 'bounce' piece off the edges of the board allowing for much more flexibility in controlling your piece movements.  Octacompass is a mix of strategy and probability which makes for a truly unique two-player gaming experience.
